thread.title: Heterosexual couple lose civil partnership court appeal - ITV News
thread.title_full: Heterosexual couple lose civil partnership court appeal - ITV News

title: Heterosexual couple lose civil partnership court appeal - ITV News
text:
21 February 2017 at 9:53am Heterosexual couple lose civil partnership court appeal Charles Keidan and Rebecca Steinfeld, pictured outside the High Court in central London. Credit: PA 
A heterosexual couple have lost their Court of Appeal battle for the right to enter into a civil partnership. 
Rebecca Steinfeld, 35, and Charles Keidan, 40, objected to the "patriarchal baggage" of marriage and wanted to ensure legal recognition of their seven-year relationship through a civil partnership. 
However they were prevented because the Civil Partnership Act 2004 says that only same-sex couples are eligible. The couple, outside the Royal Courts of Justice, last year. Credit: PA 
The couple, from Hammersmith, west London, have a 20-month-old daughter. 
They argued the Government's position is "incompatible with equality law." 
More soon.
